author: 8BrickMario
title: She rules-oh, wait. I already used that joke...
review:
While Series 15 left a surprisingly subdued emotional impact on me upon its reveal, I still enjoyed many of the figures, and the Queen here (why she's not the Classic Queen, I can't say) was at the top of my list.

Box/Instructions

Series 15 returns us to the orange color scheme, which is rather disappointing, but at least it's been saturated and metallicized, which creates a nice shiny effect. The instructions have continued the instructions from S14, showing the less intuitive assemblies (the Queen's cape, the Laser Mech's wings, and the Flying Warrior's wings). 

Parts

The Queen has some pretty nice pieces. Her cape is the same as the Classic King's, and her torso could be useful. I was delighted to see the return of Calamity Drone's hair, as I had missed out on it the first time, and I was surprised to find that it is solid ABS plastic, not rubber. The big new part here is her dress, though, which is a wide poofy style with a flat front and a curved back. Underneath the brick is a 2x2 tube configuration used on most 2x2 bricks, and the sides are hollow to make sure the clutch isn't too powerful. Of course, the best part is that this piece includes torso pegs which keep the dress securely attached to the body. 

The completed model

The Queen herself looks excellent. Her hair is very regal, with a wavy style and a bun and elegant ringlets on the back. Her hair fits a tiara quite nicely. The Queen's face looks very wise and kindly (good qualities in a ruler), and her cape, while reused, is perfectly appropriate. Her torso has a nice gold-and blue pattern over the red dress, showing a vaguely floral design. Her dress continues the pattern, adding a bit of a playing-card motif with the hearts and diamonds along the bottom, which fits the colors perfectly.

Overall opinion

This is a great figure. She's a really nice stand-alone, but when paired with her husband, she's even better. I'd definitely recommend getting her.

author: Fauch
title: good parts, under average prints
review:
The queen comes with a new mold for legs. The hair I had never seen before but I don't know if it's new. The cape appears for the 2nd time I think, after the serie 13 king.

The queen is only printed on the front and the pattern is relatively simple, no particularly subtle details that would be hard to see on a picture. The sides and back are unprinted, plain bright red.

The leg piece is flat on the front and rounded on the other sides. it is 4x2 wide but is only held by 4 studs underneath. It is the same height as normal legs, which is nice since it's weird to see lego women tower over men.

Very nicely moulded hair with a hole on top for an accessory. The tiara is good but not new, I have several of them.

The cape is made of 2 parts, the red one and the white one. they are attached by 3 points, which forces them into a specific shape, like it's floating behind the figs. At least it looks so on other minifigs, but with the specific legs shape of the queen, it seems to just follow her curves naturally. I tried the white part with other capes, it worked ok, but since they are attached by 2 point, and the white fluff by 3, that doesn't fit perfectly.

Now for the flaws, first, there is a noticeable gap between the leg prints and the torso prints. It looks to be at least 1mm. My queen also has a misprint. I don't know if that's really visible on my picture, I outlined in blue a portion of the torso. For some reason, this portion has a slight shift, it is asymmetrical and so doesn't fit the legs perfectly.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Her Highness, Queen of England!
review:
Set #71011 Queen: We received a Classic King in an early series of minifigures. So it was only a matter of time before they gave us a companion for him and what a magnificent looking minifigure she is.

The Queen looks very regal in her flowing red robes with a blue inner robe with floral printing. To match up with the Classic King she's wearing a red cape and a white collar piece. Her hair is new and includes a gold crown that just plugs in with a hole on top. Her lower torso is a brand new piece as well, massive and designed to act like a regular LEGO brick. She has no accessories, a royal cane or staff or something might have been nice to see.

I'd recommend her, she doesn't fit in anywhere aside from a Classic Castle theme, but she looks good and compliments the Classic King, I believe from Series 13, quite nicely. Good job LEGO, all we need now is a Prince, a Pauper and maybe a few more types of Knights to make a fairly fun looking Castle Themed display set.
